intro: Chirita jiuwanshanica, commonly known as the Jiuwanshan chirea, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow or orange. The plant has elliptical leaves that are usually arranged oppositely along the stems. It thrives in shady, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
